alert.note: Alert for Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 8:15PM EST until February 18 at 4:16AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from earlier excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast West Virginia, including the following county, Greenbrier. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 813 PM EST, The Meadow River gauge at Hines is approaching minor flood stage of 14 feet. This will cause minor flooding in the Charmco and Hines area, including impacting one lane of Route 60 near Charmco. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charmco - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
